activities.loc: Courtroom D, Fourth Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Karmen Rachel Poitier

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on November 10, 2022 at 11:15 am.

Activity:Arraignment 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

01:35 PM Defendant Karmen Rachel Poitier in court by video with attorney Caleb Tomaszewski by video.  Noah M Tylenda and Margaret Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendant pleads not guilty, jury trial to be set.
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Supervision Report

Activity: Waiver of preliminary hearing
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

01:48 PM Defendant Karmen Rachel Poitier in court by phone means and with attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz by video means.  David S Olson appeared for the State of Wisconsin by video means.   Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information.  Arraignment scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Justice Point: Rock County Supervision  Report
Adjourned initial appearance on April 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Activity: Initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

3:42 PM Defendant Karmen Rachel Poitier in court in custody at the Rock County Jail by video with attorney Kelly James Mattingly by video. Kyle Edward Johnson and Intern Margaret Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Signature bond set of $1,000.00 with conditions: No contact directly or indirectly with victim A.L.N.M., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. No contact with the Quality Inn. No possession of dangerous weapons. Maintain absolute sobriety. Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Must remain in residence between the hours of 6pm and 6am unless at work or traveling to and from work. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 1PM.

No contact directly or indirectly with victim A.L.N.M., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. No contact with the Quality Inn. No possession of dangerous weapons.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Must remain in residence between the hours of 6pm and 6am unless at work or traveling to and from work.
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Risk Report
